poem:
Reparations

Europe gathers borrowed courage  
as the coins of conflict  
clink in frozen vaults—  
bridges built on ice.  
  
Names written in ledgers,  
cold as winter's breath,  
yet lend a future—  
hope tendered, frost-bound  
between nations,  
on the quiet pages  
of history's ledger.
